item.title: Maths: Why is a^0=1?
item.description: Let’s find powers of 2 2^-3 = 1/8 2^-2 = 2 * 1/8 = 1/4 2^-1 = 2 * 1/4 = 1/2 2^0 = 2 * 1/2 = 1 <- This is why 2^1 = 2 * 1 = 2 2^2 = 2 * 2 = 4 2^3 = 2 * 4 = 8 In the above example we multiply by 2 as we move down. Let’s do that in reverse
